00008 using namespace Ogre;

00010 /**
00011  * Enumeration used for differentiating between different types of PhysicsObjects
00012  * TODO: This should probably be handled through subclassing
00013  */
00014 enum ObjectType { SHIP, NPC_SHIP, PROJECTILE, ANCHOR_PROJECTILE };
00015 
00016 
00017 /**
00018  * The BaseObject class represents an entity in the OreWar game world.
00019  * BaseObjects use an X, Y, Z coordinate system following Ogre's axis conventions.
00020  * (see http://www.ogre3d.org/tikiwiki/Basic+Tutorial+1&structure=Tutorials)
00021  * The coordinate system is centered with 0,0,0 in the exact center of the game
00022  * world. Orientation is stored as a quaternion with <0, 0, -1> as the base
00023  * heading (to correspond with the default for Ogre cameras, scene nodes, etc.)
00024  */
00025 class BaseObject
00026 {
00027 private:
00028     /** The current position of the object */
00029     Vector3 m_position;
00030 
00031     /** The current orientation of the object (as a rotation from the base <0, 0, -1> heading) */
00032     Quaternion m_orientation;
00033 
00034 public:
00035     /** Construct a new BaseObject at a specified position with default heading (<0, 0,-1>) */
00036     BaseObject(Vector3 position);
00037 
00038     /** Copy constructor */
00039     BaseObject(const BaseObject& copy);
00040 
00041     /** Construct a new BaseObject at the origin with default heading (<0, 0,-1>) */
00042     BaseObject();
00043 
00044     /** Yaw the object by the specified number of radians (positive for right yaw) */
00045     void yaw(Radian radians);
00046 
00047     /** Roll the object by the specified number of radians (positive for counter-clockwise roll) */
00048     void roll(Radian radians);
00049 
00050     /** Pitch the object by the specified number of radians (positive for forward pitch) */
00051     void pitch(Radian radians);
00052 
00053     /** Sets the position of the object */
00054     void position(Vector3 position);
00055 
00056     /** Calculates the relative displacement between this object and the specified object */
00057     Vector3 displacement(const BaseObject& other);
00058 
00059     /** @return The position of the object */
00060     Vector3 position() const;
00061 
00062     /** @return The heading of the object (normalised vector pointing "forward" fom it's current orientation) */
00063     Vector3 heading() const;
00064 
00065     /** @return The normal vector of the object (normalised vector pointing "up" from it's current orientation) */
00066     Vector3 normal() const;
00067 
00068     /** @return The orientation quaternion of the object (with <0, 0, -1> as the base heading) */
00069     Quaternion orientation() const;
00070 
00071     /** Sets the orientation of the object */
00072     void orientation(Quaternion orientation);
00073 };
00074 
00075 
00076 /**
00077  * The PhysicsObject class represents an object in the OreWar game world which is subject
00078  * to physics simulation. Physics objects have a set mass, and forces can be applied
00079  * to produce motion when the updatePosition() method is called. The velocity and acceleration
00080  * can also be directly manipulated in cases where forces are unnecessary. All properties
00081  * use the same coordinate orientation as those in the BaseObject class.
00082  */
00083 class PhysicsObject : public BaseObject
00084 {
00085 private:
00086     /** The type of the object (see ObjectType enum) */
00087     ObjectType m_type;
00088 
00089     /** The mass of the object */
00090     Real m_mass;
00091 
00092     /** The velocity of the object */
00093     Vector3 m_velocity;
00094 
00095     /** The acceleration of the object */
00096     Vector3 m_acceleration;
00097 
00098     /** The sum vector of all persistent forces current applied on the object. */
00099     Vector3 m_force;
00100 
00101     /** 
00102      * The sum vector of all temporary forces currently applied on the object.
00103      * Temporary forces are cleared on each physics update.
00104      */
00105     Vector3 m_tempForce;
00106 
00107 public:
00108     /** 
00109      * Construct a PhysicsObject at the given position coordinates with the
00110      * specified mass and default heading (<0, 0, -1>).
00111      */
00112     PhysicsObject(ObjectType type, Real mass, Vector3 position);
00113 
00114     /**
00115      * Construct a PhysicsObject at the origin with the specified mass 
00116      * with default heading (<0, 0, -1>)
00117      */
00118     PhysicsObject(ObjectType type, Real mass);
00119 
00120     /** Copy constructor */
00121     PhysicsObject(const PhysicsObject& copy);
00122 
00123     /** @return The type of the object (see ObjectType enum) */
00124     ObjectType type() const;
00125 
00126     /** @return The mass of the object */
00127     Real mass() const;
00128 
00129     /** Sets the velocity of the object */
00130     void velocity(Vector3 velocity);
00131 
00132     /** Sets the acceleration of the object */
00133     void acceleration(Vector3 acceleration);
00134 
00135     /** @return The velocity of the object */
00136     Vector3 getVelocity() const;
00137 
00138     /** @return The acceleration of the object */
00139     Vector3 acceleration() const;
00140 
00141     /** @return The vector sum of permanent all (not cleared on physics update) forces on the object */
00142     Vector3 sumForces() const;
00143 
00144     /** @return The vector sum of all temporary (cleared on physics update) forces on the object */
00145     Vector3 sumTempForces() const;
00146 
00147     /** 
00148      * Applies an addititve force on the object which will be taken into account
00149      * on the next physics update.
00150      */
00151     void applyForce(Vector3 force);
00152 
00153     /** 
00154      * Applies an addititve force on the object which will be taken into account
00155      * and cleared on the next physics update.
00156      */
00157     void applyTempForce(Vector3 force);
00158 
00159     /** Remove all forces (temporary and persistent) all force currently applied to the object */
00160     void clearForces();
00161 
00162     /**
00163      * Updates the object's position, taking all physics parameters into
00164      * account as well as the time elapsed since the last position update
00165      * (in seconds).
00166      */
00167     virtual void updatePhysics(Real timeElapsed);
00168 };
00169 
00170 /**
00171  * The Constaint class represents a connection between two physics objects
00172  * which should apply force based on some condition (ropes or springs for
00173  * example.
00174  */
00175 class Constraint
00176 {
00177 private:
00178     /** The originating object of the constraint */
00179     PhysicsObject * m_origin;
00180 
00181     /** The target object of the constraint */
00182     PhysicsObject * m_target;
00183 
00184     /** The distance between the two objects at the time of creation */
00185     Real m_distance;
00186 
00187 public:
00188     /** Construct a constraint between the two provided objects */
00189     Constraint(PhysicsObject * origin, PhysicsObject * target);
00190 
00191     /** Copy constructor */
00192     Constraint(const Constraint& copy);
00193 
00194     /** @return The origin object of the constraint */
00195     PhysicsObject * getOrigin();
00196 
00197     /** @return The target object of the constraint */
00198     PhysicsObject * getTarget();
00199 
00200     /** Applies temporary forces on one or both of the constraint objects based on the elapsed time */
00201     void applyForces(Real timeElapsed);
00202 };

00205 /**
00206  * The SphereCollisionObject represents a physical object whose collisions should be
00207  * modelled as a sphere.
00208  */
00209 class SphereCollisionObject : public PhysicsObject
00210 {
00211 private:
00212     /** The radius of the object */
00213     Real m_radius;
00214 public:
00215     /** 
00216      * Construct a SphereCollisionObject at the given position coordinates with the
00217      * specified mass and default heading (<0, 0, -1>).
00218      */
00219     SphereCollisionObject(ObjectType type, Real radius, Real mass, Vector3 position);
00220 
00221     /**
00222      * Construct a SphereCollisionObject at the origin with the specified mass 
00223      * with default heading (<0, 0, -1>)
00224      */
00225     SphereCollisionObject(ObjectType type, Real radius, Real mass);
00226 
00227     /** Copy constructor */
00228     SphereCollisionObject(const SphereCollisionObject& copy);
00229 
00230     /** @return The radius of the object */
00231     Real radius() const;
00232 
00233     /** @return True if the passed object intersects with the sphere */
00234     bool checkCollision(const SphereCollisionObject& object) const;
00235 };
